moves.5... Nxe4: I lose that pawn too often. Funny enough I usually win afterward. Maybe someone should consider this some kind of gambit. (LOL)
moves.6. Ne5 d6 7. Qf3 Nf6 8. Nd3 O-O 9. h4 c6: Going on the pawn attack. I like castling on the other side of wherever my opponent does so that my pawns can weaken him.
moves.15... a5 16. Nd3 Ba6 17. h5 Bxc4: There was no way to defend that pawn except moving Nc1 which was not worth it. Sacking the pawn was better.
moves.18. Qe3 Nd5: My queen was getting less and less space.
moves.19. Qh6: It's easy to get locked in this was but I couldn't see how he would do that in the next few moves.
moves.19... Bxd3 20. cxd3 Nb4 21. Bf1: One piece clear of an impending mate on the h file. And a test to see how materialistic my opponent was. Making it look as if I didn't see the check on c2.
moves.21... Nc2+ 22. Kd1 Nxa1: Wrong move. Materialism is not always a good principle in chess. Mate in 2 was inescapable from this point on.
